column2: Description
Rhubarb upside-down cake and Oregon croissant. Morning bun and amazing baked goods.
Cock n' balls donut. Peanut butter and chocolate. Bacon Maple Bar.
Must. Juicy-medium-rare-slaw burger, foie gras profiteroles with caramel sauce and sea salt, beef cheek bourguignon, cornbread-maple ice cream bacon-bit dessert.
Must. Bacon wrapped dates, chocolate potato doughnut with creme anglaise, polenta with sausage ragu.
Good-ass mexican food. Tamales, chile relleno, and outstanding carnitas, fresh tortillas.
Tartufo bianco with truffle oil. NYC white pie. Limited dough.
Must. Pear and blue cheese almond brittle with ganache. Ice cream that is "life-altering good."
Best fried chicken ever. Get there early.
Omelet and sourdough toast. Regular diner cafe food?
Sesame pretzel croissant. Almond croissant. Rose macaroons.
Cold fried chicken sandwich. Lamb special. Fun cocktails.
Must. Boar-collar, papaya salad, salted plum vodka collins, fish sauce wings.
Amazing sushi. Amazing seafood. Amazing wagyu beef burger.
Solid, wood fired oven pizza.
Must. Korean fried chicken, cornmeal pancake, potatoes bravas, and bread pudding.
Get the batch truffles, have some hot cocoa and coffee.
Bugolgi beef burritos with kimchee rice + tacos.
Great food, great cocktails, great staff. Sous Vide prepared meats, cauliflower panna cotta, hipster French preparations.
North African, Middle Eastern, Iberian, Sephardic, Jewish cuisine.
Chicken and pork broth that takes two days to make?
Cuban food. Cuban comfort.
Cocoa dusted glazed donut. Not interesting, but good.
Cake donuts.
Cinammon doughnuts, inherited by Moody's Donuts.
Old-fashioned glazed.
Best hidden brunch in Portland.

Wild-fish. Fresh tacos. Sriracha cream sauce.

Fizzy lifting drink. Fresh ginger, plum drinking vinegar, salted plum rocks, and ginger ale. Ice cream sandwiches, trailer baked chocolate chip cookies with roasted banana and salted caramel ice cream.
Fish and chips, bitch.
Khao man gai. Chicken and rice. One item menu.
Czech food. Crisp pork with a juicy center with ajvar (red pepper spread), sour creamy horseradish, and caramelized onions in a soft ciabatta.

Description
Worth many trips. Color coded sections. Getting lost in here is fun. Has a transgender section. Stunning collection.
Great place to walk. Lots of bikes and skateboards. Riverside view is nice. 1.5 miles.

column1: Oregon Museum of Science and Industry (OMSI)
column2: Great place to bring kids and make them smarter. So...what about a seasoned biochemistry public health buttface and a to be veterinarian? Exceeds the Exploratorium in SF.
One of the most beautiful places on earth. Far in the east. Drive through the gorge. Hiking and a picturesque waterfall.
Natural, happy animals. IS THERE A HORNBILL?
Beautiful, touristy, hard climb.
Good variety. Good vendors. Shit ton of wild mushrooms. Baked and cooked goods available as well.
